result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis Lee Suriano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Possess Methamphetamine Precursors [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.65.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DNA sample unless already provided. 
Complete AODA at discretion of agent and continued treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
No contact with Chance Kratochvil and Rebecca Holzem.
Participate in any counseling or assessments as deemed beneficial by agent.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis Lee Suriano

records.addlTxt: 3:30 p.m. in Room 301. 20CF149 and 22CF80. Sentencing after revocation hearing on 20CF149.  State appears by Elizabeth Gebert by Zoom. Def. appears in court via Zoom, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  20CF149 - Sentencing after revocation on Ct. 2 only. Def. can hear, has received revocation packet, no errors or corrections. Consents to appearing by Zoom. State has no corrections, deletions or additions. Recommendation: 1 year jail.  101 days credit. Def. makes statement. The Court will abide by recommendation, orders on Ct. 2 on 20CF149 - 1 year county jail, Huber, 101 days already served. Any outstanding financial obligations be converted to civil judgment.  No additional credit to be used on 22CF80. Post conviction rights. State  has complied with victim rights.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
2:02 PM in Room 301. Defendant Curtis Lee Suriano appeared by video, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All appearances are by Zoom. Def. can hear, understands and consents to proceeding by Zoom. State recites agreement. Def. to  plead to Ct. 1 and 2. Cts. 3 and 4 to be DRI.  Joint recommendation. 6 years prison (3 ic, 3 es), imposed/stayed, consecutive to any other sentence, 4 years probation, costs with DNA surcharge, DNA sample, AODA and  follow through, maintain absolute sobriety, no contact with individuals as named on record, obtain fulltime employment, counseling as deemed necessary by agent. Ct. 2 - Withheld sentence, 4 years probation, costs with DNA surcharge, comply with conditions of Ct. 1.  Def. agrees with terms. Waiver of P.H. reviewed. Def. wants to waive P.H. Court finds Def. has waived P.H., finds probable cause and binds over for filing of Information. Def. does not have copy. Def. waives reading on understanding it mirrors criminal complaint. Court accepts waiver of reading and indicates Information will be supplied to Def. Plea questionnaire reviewed. 
Def. pleads to Ct. 1 - Attempt to Manufacture/Deliver amphetamine, PTAC, no contest; Ct. 2 - Poss. meth precursers, PTAC, no contest. The Court grants State's motion to DRI Cts. 3 and 4.  Constitutional rights, elements and possible penalties reviewed. The Court finds that Def. understand and that pleas are freely and voluntarily given. Court finds there is a factual basis, accepts pleas and finds Def. guilty of Ct. 1 and Ct. 2. Sentencing argument by State. Def. makes statement. Remarks by the Court. 
The Court will abide by agreement, orders
Ct. 1 - imposed/stayed 6 years prison (3 years init. conf., 3 years ext. sup), consecutive to any other sentence already received, 4 years probation, costs only including DNA surcharge, DNA sample unless already provided, AODA at discretion of agent and continued treatment, maintain absolute sobriety, no contact with  Chance Kratochvil. and Rebecca Holzem, maintain full time employment 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for. t, counseling or assessments as deemed beneficial by agent. Ct. 2 - Withheld sentence, 4 years probation, costs with DNA surcharge, same conditions of Ct. 1. Eligible for earned release program but not eligible for challenge incarceration. 
Credit: State indicates needs a sentencing after revocation hearing date for a different case to determine credit on this case. Will determine credit on this case at time of sentencing after revocation on 20CF149. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  
The Court will give zero credit today on 22CF80. Voting/firearm rights. Post conviction rights.  
SAR on 20CF149 on June 22, 2022 at 10:30 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 17, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on June 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

01:05 PM Defendant Curtis Lee Suriano in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Curtis Lee Suriano appeared by video means. Def. would like to represent himself.  Court reviews Status of Counsel filed by Public Defender with defendant.  Court goes over waiver of attorney rights with defendant. Court finds waiver is freely & voluntarily and finds def. is competent to represent himself. Def. waives time limits for p.h.  Court accepts waiver of time limits for p.h. DA Gebert will get defendant an offer.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

No contact with Rebecca Holzem & Chance Kratochvil.
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.

03:56 PM Defendant Curtis Lee Suriano in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Curtis Lee Suriano appeared by video means.  All parties via zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. would like to represent himself. Court will set for waiver of atty rights.  State gives bail/bond recommendation and would like to continue in GF filed. Def. heard on bond. Def. is on probation hold. Court orders $10,000 cash bond with conditions. Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

No contact with Rebecca Holzem & Chance Kratochvil.
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.

Court calls @ 1:41pm.  Elizabeth Gebert appears via zoom.  Defendant is in custody and via zoom.  Court advised of attorney rights.  State gives facts for probable cause and possible charges Maintain/Mnf Meth, Poss of Meth/Waste & Poss of Drg Paraph, as repeater. State gives bail/bond recommendation. Defendant is on a probation hold. State gives criminal history. Def. heard on bond. Court orders $10,000 cash bond with No contact with Rebecca Holzem & Chance Kratochvil &  No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. Court will reserve right to be heard on bond @ later date. Initial appearance 4-18-22 @ 1:30.
